content.description: A highly engaging face/slab route. Sustained climbing on tiny edges throughout. Bring your game face, this one doesn't let up until you clip the anchor. Highly reccomended
content.protection: Many bolts. This one is well protected!
content.location: Far left of the "Main face right" area. Starts beside the cracks of "Short Attention Span"

content.description: Ever wondered what a 5.12 slab looks like? Well this is your chance. Jam the undercling, get your feet up, clip the first bolt and then stare at the blank wall. If you can unlock the secrets to making this go, I'll mail you 5 bucks.
content.location: The blank looking bolted face beside the infamous arete.

content.description: Great climb with a boulder problem start that is the crux. After the first 15 or so feet its cruising up big holds. Another climb with holds, uncharacteristic of squarenail. Get on it!
content.protection: 7 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with no rings

content.description:
Climbs the bolted edge formed by MG1.

A fine slab outing with some knobs, a cool dike and enjoyable climbing all around.
content.location: Starts from the anchors at the top of the infamous arete, climb straight up the bolted line

content.description: Start up the easy crack and flake system, through some munge, and then onto the tightly bolted face (crux). Enjoyable moves on the face make this worth the effort. Soft for the grade
content.protection: 0.5 and 0.7 cam to protect the crack, then bolts above.
content.location: This route is on the far left of the Main face right.

content.description: Climb the improbable looking face. Blowing the 2nd bolt might not be good, best to be solid at the grade before committing to the lead or stick clip that one. Climbing eases somewhat above the 2nd bolt. An optional second pitch continues past the first low anchor (10b)
content.location: The bolted face to the right of the big corner system (MG1). Starts on a ledge which can be accessed with from the infamous arete (5.7) or making the bouldering problem at the end of the infamous undercling (10a).

content.description:
4 bolts, 2 bolt ring anchor

Easy 1st bolt, Deck on boulder potential for 2nd bolt. Crux is going for the 2nd bolt. Fun technical moves and sequence. Sharp thin edges and nipples to pinch with needle point toes. Dyno onto slopper at top
content.location: Right of The World According to Mark. Runs up the quartz dike

climbs.name: Plasma P.
climbs.fa: FA Trevor Crough and Cory Brooks, 02/07/2021

content.location: Starts on the same slab as lower deck. Rap in from a set of anchors located below “The world according to Mark”.  Climb start on the far (climbers) right side of the slab.

content.description: Mr. Wizards bigger and better brother. Protect the start well as this is the crux. Lieback the wide section or squeeze it if you can fit, then it’s glorious liebacking fun to the chains.
content.location: Obvious right facing corner that starts off a big grassy ledge with rap anchors on it. Approach via rappel or climbing Infamous Arete (5.7) from the bottom.

content.description: Fun movement, little bit of everything on it. Non characteristic of squarenail. Meaning steep with  holds. While this is short it really packs a punch. Go climb it.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a two bolt anchor with rings

content.description: Fun short route consisting of a few boulder problems with rests. Well protected and easy for the grade.
content.location: Upper Tier of the right side. Climb the first pitch of  “surprised by love” or “ground zero” to access the start of this climb, or do them as one long fun pitch. There’s room left with a 70m

content.description:
Crux is right off the deck, which leads to cruiser moderate friction climbing, typical of Squarenail. The route is new, so there is still some exfoliation, watch out for exploding patina edges.

Its now possible to do a 3 pitch link-up, climb "Lower Deck", then "World according to Mark" and then one of the three route on the center wall. From the very end of Playground ledge 3 single rope raps will get out to the bottom.
content.location:
Located on the slabs directly below "Main wall - right/center". The anchor bolts are located climber's left of the climb "The world according to Mark", towards the large tree.

Rap in, climb out

content.description: stellar thin crack that goes up a stout boulder
content.location:
First boulder hidden off the left of the trail with rap rings on-top

if topping out of main face right, directly above mass casualty.

content.description: It's an arete you can climb. It's okay. Pales in comparison to the other climbs around it. I think people use it to commute to other climbs above it.

content.location: To the left of the infamous arete. (Not very infamous)

content.description: This route takes the slab/corner just to the left of Crossroads. Make an easy boulder move out of the infamous undercling and climb up the face to gain the first high bolt. Traverse right  towards crossroads and gain the corner climb up to the last bolt and then climb the blank slab up to the high anchor above. Very run-out
content.location: Starts at the end of the end of the infamous undercling, and to the left of crossroads

content.description: This is really two totally different style routes in one. Starts out in a steep left facing corner on gear. Really fun moves will take you to a bolt. More fun will bring you to another. Then the business...turn the lip, clip the next bolt and some 10+ slab awaits.
content.location: Probably should buy the guidebook from cressmans at this point. Right side of the right side. Left of metropolis.

content.description: Short and sweet. Some steep juggy fun moves. If only it were longer
content.location: to the right of Crossroads. The far right of the wall
